article: The Girl with the Cut - out Face When I was a child, I often looked through a family album. I remember asking my mother why there was a  _  cut out of a photo of a little girl. But it was  _  that my mother did not want to talk about it.  Every time  I looked at the album I saw that cut - out face and  _  about it. I figured there was something  _  . When I was grown up and had almost  _  about the photo, my mother must have realized I should know her  _  . She sat me down one day and said, "That cat - up photo is  _  your Aunt Anna. She has schizophrenia ." But why did my mother never  _  this before? I still didn't understand. "Because people are... were...  _  of having mental illness in the family" was the  _  . But I wanted to meet Aunt Anna, and I  _  . My mother and I traveled to the house  _  Anna lived with an Italian family. Anna looked like a question mark on legs,  _  she had lovely, clear eyes and a gentle manner. I could see the  _  to my mother. "So nice to meet you," she said to me. "Do you have a trunk (;)?" Did she think that I was an elephant? No, she wanted to run  _  and hide in the trunk of my car. The family that  _  her said that she always wanted to  _  . The last time I saw Anna she was placed in a smaller old - age facility in Brooklyn.  _  Aunt Anna, I'm not the least bit ashamed of you. I'm  _  about you now for many to see, with your sweet young face showing under a pretty bow. And you finally found that escape you were seeking.
